ETYMOLOGY: From Latin detrimentum 'a rubbing off, loss, damage', from deterere 'wear away, rub off' (from de- 'away from' + terere 'to rub').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The state of being harmed or damaged; a cause of harm or damage.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 损害；不利；损伤的原因；危害
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Smoking is a major detriment to your health.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 吸烟对你的健康有很大的损害。

REGISTER: Formal or general use, often in discussions of consequences or negative impacts.
